intro: Sambucus ebulus var. deborensis, commonly known as the Deborensis elderberry, is a variant of the elderberry plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers that appear in late spring, followed by dark purple berries in the fall. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has compound leaves with serrated edges. It is part of the Caprifoliaceae family and is known for its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine. However, its berries are toxic and should not be consumed raw.
